application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled:

Site and location plan of 4 Ashbourne close; Existing & proposed side elevations (Drawing number: DWG/02) Revision 02; Existing & proposed front rear elevations (Drawing number: DWG/01) Revision 02; Existing & proposed first floor plans (Drawing number: DWG/04) Revision 00; Existing & proposed ground floor plans (Drawing number: DWG/03) Revision 02; Existing & proposed garden/ driveway plans (Drawing number: DWG/06) Revision 01; Existing & proposed roof plans (Drawing number: DWG/05) Revision 02;

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), polices D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
